judges: Before Jones, O. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and McBride, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Our study of the will involved in this case has developed no reason for differing with the interpretation placed thereon by the court below. Accordingly, the decree appealed from is affirmed.
Decree affirmed at the appellant’s costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: James H. Booser, with him D:Edward Chaplin■, Gilbert Nurick, and Chaplin <& Arnold, and McNees, Wallace <& Nurick, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
Cross Trust.
Argued November 12, 1959.
Before Jones, O. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Bok and McBride, JJ.
December 31, 1959:
James H. Booser, with him D:Edward Chaplin■, Gilbert Nurick, and Chaplin <& Arnold, and McNees, Wallace <& Nurick, for appellant.
Carl A. Belin, for appellee.
